rawData.title: James Meek · Computers that want things
rawData.summary: An exploration of artificial intelligence's lack of genuine desires and motivations, centered around the historic 2016 Go match between Lee Sedol and AlphaGo, and the philosophical implications for developing artificial general intelligence (AGI) with genuine wants and ethics.

rawData.title: Strong Prime Day Discounts on Our Favorite Coffee and Espresso Machines
rawData.summary: Amazon Prime Day features significant discounts on popular coffee and espresso machines, including deals on Breville, Ninja, De'Longhi, and other top brands, with savings ranging from $50 to $200 on various models.

rawData.title: Qualcomm is acquiring DIY electronics platform Arduino
rawData.summary: Qualcomm is acquiring Arduino, the open-source electronics platform, while launching the Uno Q board that combines Qualcomm's processor with a microcontroller and supports AI capabilities.

rawData.title: Score a Deal on Some WIRED-Tested Pet Gear This Prime Day
rawData.summary: Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days features discounts on pet technology products including DNA test kits, automatic feeders, pet cameras, and cleaning tools that have been tested by WIRED reviewers.

rawData.title: The best October Prime Day deals on TVs, soundbars, and more
rawData.summary: Amazon's October Prime Day features significant discounts on home entertainment gear, including OLED TVs from LG and Samsung, soundbars, and streaming devices from major brands like Roku and Google.

rawData.title: Turns Out, the Best Prime Day Pillow Sale Isn't on Amazon
rawData.summary: Lagoon Performance Pillows, known for their adjustable memory foam pillows endorsed by professional athletes, is offering a $20 discount on all models during Amazon Prime Day period, though the sale is directly through their website.

rawData.title: OpenAI and the race for AI-driven commerce | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI is positioning ChatGPT as a commerce platform by integrating shopping capabilities and third-party apps, allowing users to make purchases and access services directly through the chatbot interface while potentially competing with major retailers like Amazon.

rawData.title: The Beauty Products Our Reviewers Are Shopping on Prime Day
rawData.summary: WIRED reviews Prime Day beauty deals, highlighting tested and vetted products including LED face masks, dry shampoo, and skincare items with significant discounts ranging from 19-48% off regular prices.

rawData.title: Google hints at a new Nest Hub
rawData.summary: Google's smart home executive confirms the company remains committed to smart displays and will announce new Nest Hub products soon, suggesting an updated device that could better leverage its Gemini AI platform.

rawData.title: The excellent Pixel 9A has dropped to just $349 for Amazon’s fall Prime Day
rawData.summary: Google's Pixel 9A smartphone is available for an all-time low price of $349 ($150 off) during Amazon's October Prime Day sale, offering features like a 6.3-inch OLED screen, IP68 rating, and seven years of software updates.

rawData.title: Apple turned the CrowdStrike BSOD issue into an anti-PC ad
rawData.summary: Apple released an 8-minute commercial mocking Windows security by referencing last year's CrowdStrike incident that caused widespread Blue Screen of Death issues on Windows PCs, promoting Macs as a more secure alternative.

rawData.title: Google’s extreme smart home makeover
rawData.summary: Google is revitalizing its smart home efforts by integrating Gemini AI, with the company's product head discussing how AI technology could transform home device interactions and management.

rawData.title: California bans noisy ads on Netflix, YouTube, and other streaming services
rawData.summary: California has passed a law requiring streaming services like Netflix, YouTube, and Hulu to maintain consistent volume levels between content and advertisements, with enforcement beginning July 2026.

rawData.title: xAI hires former Morgan Stanley banker Anthony Armstrong as CFO | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Former Morgan Stanley banker Anthony Armstrong has been appointed as CFO of xAI and X, following their merger in April, where he will oversee finances for both companies after previously advising Musk on the Twitter acquisition.

rawData.title: How AI is changing the way we travel
rawData.summary: AI technologies are transforming the travel industry through personalized trip planning, automated booking adjustments, and intelligent recommendations for accommodations and activities.

rawData.title: The 162 best October Prime Day deals
rawData.summary: Amazon's October Prime Day sale features significant discounts on tech products including headphones, smartwatches, TVs, and other electronics, with many items priced lower than during July's Prime Day event.

rawData.title: The Techno Optimist’s Guide to Futureproofing Your Child
rawData.summary: Parents and tech leaders are grappling with how to prepare children for a future potentially transformed by AI, questioning whether traditional educational and career paths will remain relevant as technology reshapes work and society.

rawData.title: Jony Ive Says He Wants His OpenAI Devices to ‘Make Us Happy’
rawData.summary: Former Apple designer Jony Ive and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman discussed their collaboration on developing AI hardware devices, aiming to create products that improve people's relationship with technology and make them 'happy, fulfilled, and less anxious' rather than focusing solely on productivity.

rawData.title: The Supreme Court didn’t save Google from Epic, and now the clock is ticking
Microsoft is plugging more holes that let you use Windows 11 without an online account
